intro: Clarkia similis, commonly known as the California clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Clarkia similis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils.
